speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: SCENE XII. Egypt. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, DOLABELLA, THYREUS, with others

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Let him appear that's come from Antony.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Know you him?

speaker: DOLABELLA
text_entry: Caesar, 'tis his schoolmaster:

speaker: DOLABELLA
text_entry: An argument that he is pluck'd, when hither

speaker: DOLABELLA
text_entry: He sends so poor a pinion off his wing,

speaker: DOLABELLA
text_entry: Which had superfluous kings for messengers

speaker: DOLABELLA
text_entry: Not many moons gone by.

speaker: DOLABELLA
text_entry: Enter EUPHRONIUS, ambassador from MARK ANTONY

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Approach, and speak.

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: Such as I am, I come from Antony:

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: I was of late as petty to his ends

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: As is the morn-dew on the myrtle-leaf

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: To his grand sea.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Be't so: declare thine office.

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: Lord of his fortunes he salutes thee, and

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: Requires to live in Egypt: which not granted,

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: He lessens his requests; and to thee sues

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: To let him breathe between the heavens and earth,

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: A private man in Athens: this for him.

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: Next, Cleopatra does confess thy greatness;

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: Submits her to thy might; and of thee craves

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: The circle of the Ptolemies for her heirs,

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: Now hazarded to thy grace.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: For Antony,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I have no ears to his request. The queen

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Of audience nor desire shall fail, so she

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: From Egypt drive her all-disgraced friend,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Or take his life there: this if she perform,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: She shall not sue unheard. So to them both.

speaker: EUPHRONIUS
text_entry: Fortune pursue thee!

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Bring him through the bands.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Exit EUPHRONIUS

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: To THYREUS

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: From Antony win Cleopatra: promise,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And in our name, what she requires; add more,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: From thine invention, offers: women are not

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: In their best fortunes strong; but want will perjure

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The ne'er touch'd vestal: try thy cunning, Thyreus;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Make thine own edict for thy pains, which we

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Will answer as a law.

speaker: THYREUS
text_entry: Caesar, I go.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Observe how Antony becomes his flaw,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And what thou think'st his very action speaks

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: In every power that moves.

speaker: THYREUS
text_entry: Caesar, I shall.

speaker: THYREUS
text_entry: Exeunt
